name: Claife Viewing Station to Wray Castle trail, Claife Viewing Station

ai.summary: A demanding long-distance lakeside hike in the Lake District, this route connects Claife Viewing Station with Wray Castle along Windermere’s shore. At 35.9 km, the trail combines lakefront paths, forest tracks, and occasional rocky or muddy sections. It suits experienced hikers who can manage a long day (or split into two) and enjoy sweeping lake views, woodland scenery, and historic viewpoints around Windermere.
ai.terrain_summary: Stretches along Windermere’s shoreline with a mix of flat lakefront paths, gravel tracks, and forest trails. Expect some steep or uneven sections, muddy patches after rain, and occasional exposed spots near the water. Navigation is straightforward but signage can be sparse in remote segments.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day: check weather forecasts, as conditions can change quickly along the lake. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and carry layers, a map and compass or GPS, and sufficient water and food. Daylight hours vary by season; in remote sections mobile signal may be limited. Be prepared for muddy footing, wind along the shore, and brief stretches away from services; tell someone your planned return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
First aid kit and blister care
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to autumn (May–Sept) offers the best conditions with longer daylight and lower rainfall; winter hiking is possible with extra gear and shorter days.

seo.title: Claife Viewing Station to Wray Castle Trail – 35.9 km Hard Lakes Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore the challenging 35.9 km hike from Claife Viewing Station to Wray Castle along Windermere in the Lake District. A hard, lakeside route with mixed terrain—plan a long day or two.
seo.h1: Claife Viewing Station to Wray Castle Trail – 35.9 km (Hard, Lakes)
